1.name: Shoulder Arms
1.description: Charlie is a boot camp private who has a dream of being a hero who goes on a daring mission behind enemy lines.

2.name: Berg-Ejvind och hans hustru
2.description: A stranger comes to work at widow Halla's farm. Halla and the stranger fall in love, but when he is revealed as Eyvind, an escaped thief forced into crime by his family's starvation, they ...                See full summary »

3.name: Stella Maris
3.description: Two young women - a paraplegic girl sheltered by her wealthy guardians and a more experienced orphan - fall in love with a man separated from his violent wife.

4.name: Tarzan of the Apes
4.description: Kohn and Alice Clayton set sail for Africa. Mutineers maroon them. After his parents die, the newborn Tarzan is taken by a great Ape, Kala. Later the boy finds his father's knife and uses ...                See full summary »

5.name: Ich möchte kein Mann sein
5.description: A teenaged tomboy, tired of being bossed around by her strict guardian, impersonates a man so she can have more fun, but discovers that being the opposite sex isn't as easy as she had hoped.

6.name: Mickey
6.description: Mickey, an orphan who has been brought up in a mining settlement, is sent to New York to live with her aunt.

7.name: Little Women
7.description: Jo March and her sisters Meg, Beth, and Amy live in a happy family in Concord, Massachusetts. Jo yearns to be a writer, and through the course of the years, finds much within her own family...                See full summary »

8.name: The Blue Bird
8.description: Two peasant children, Mytyl and Tyltyl, are led by Berylune, a fairy, to search for the Blue Bird of Happiness. Berylune gives Tyltyl a cap with a diamond setting, and when Tyltyl turns the...                See full summary »

9.name: Carmen
9.description: The tragic story of Don Jose, a Spanish cavalryman, who falls under the spell of a gypsy girl, Carmen, who treats him with both love and contempt and leads him into temptation and thus ...                See full summary »

10.name: Hearts of the World
10.description: Young lovers in a French village are torn apart with the coming of the Great War.

11.name: Die Augen der Mumie Ma
11.description: A girl is kidnapped and held captive in an ancient Egyptian temple. She is rescued and flees to England, but soon finds that her mysterious captor is still haunting her.

12.name: Otets Sergiy
12.description: Prince Kasatsky is a just and proud youth, shock and disappointment with the world bring him to church, he becomes father Sergius. It is a story of his piety and temptation.

13.name: Himmelskibet
13.description: A group of the researchers from the Earth in a spaceship traveling to Mars, where, to big surprise, finds a peaceful vegetarian and pacifist civilization.

15.name: Riders of the Purple Sage
15.description: Lassiter, a Texas Ranger, goes after the sect which has abducted his sister Millie. During his search, he encounters Jane Withersteen, who owns a rich estate. Lassiter saves a man named ...                See full summary »

16.name: The Master Mystery
16.description: Justice Department agent Quentin Locke must investigate a powerful cartel protected by a robot (here referred to as "The Automaton") and using a gas weapon "The Madagascar Madness".

18.name: The Married Virgin
18.description: An already engaged young woman is blackmailed into marrying a count in order to save her father from imprisonment.

19.name: The Dream Lady
19.description: After receiving an inheritance from an uncle, a woman sets up a fortunetelling business.

20.name: Amarilly of Clothes-Line Alley
20.description: Amarilly comes from a large family in a working-class neighborhood. She is happy with her family and her boyfriend Terry, a bartender in a cafe. But one day she meets Gordon, a sculptor who...                See full summary »

21.name: Salome
21.description: When Herodias divorces her husband and marries his brother Herod Antipas, governor of Judea, the prophet John the Baptist protests and is imprisoned. Salome, daughter of Herodias and both ...                See full summary »

22.name: Little Miss Hoover
22.description: During World War I, Washington, D.C. society girl Nancy Craddock decides to enlist in the Food Administration on the theory that "eggs will win the war."

25.name: The Greatest Thing in Life
25.description: Jeannette Peret, daughter of a cigar-store owner, leaves her Greenwich Village home for France in hopes of finding there the love which eludes her at home. She becomes enamored of le Bebe, ...                See full summary »

26.name: The Romance of Tarzan
26.description: Tarzan and Jane are to sail for England. They are attacked by natives and Tarzan is believed to have been killed. The Greystoke relatives return to England, the Porters (Jane's family) goes...                See full summary »

27.name: Shifting Sands
27.description: Marcia Grey is wrongly convicted on trumped-up evidence of a German. After serving her term, she rebuilds her life and marries well. The German then attempts to blackmail her into helping ...                See full summary »

28.name: Broadway Love
28.description: A small-town girl goes to New York hoping to become a star on Broadway, but the best she can do are roles as chorus girls. She falls in with a "fast" crowd, notably a "party girl" named ...                See full summary »

29.name: Hell Bent
29.description: A cowboy must save his girlfriend from captivity and then cross the desert on foot with a single waterhole on the way.

31.name: Arizona
31.description: An Army lieutenant at a remote post in Arizona tells a young woman that he does not love her, so she contrives to marry his commanding officer, who is also his best friend.

32.name: Huck and Tom
32.description: The adventures of Huckleberry Finn and Tom Sawyer.

34.name: Little Orphant Annie
34.description: Surrounded by a group of children, poet James Whitcomb Riley narrates the story of Little Orphant Annie, who loses her mother at an early age and is sent to an orphanage. Annie charms the ...                See full summary »

35.name: The Heart of Humanity
35.description: An American woman is terrorized by the ravages of war and a lecherous Prussian lieutenant when she becomes a Red Cross nurse overseas during the Great War.

37.name: The Squaw Man
37.description: Captain Wynnegate leaves England, accepting the blame for embezzling charity funds though knowing that his cousin Sir Henry is guilty. Out West he and the Indian girl Nat-U-Rich save each ...                See full summary »

38.name: The Lonely Woman
38.description: The reticence of Martha Sellers and her employment of Jim Ransom, a drunkard, excites the curiosity of the villagers. She receives mail postmarked "Ossining," and this further stirs the ...                See full summary »

39.name: Johanna Enlists
39.description: A young girl, stifling on her father's backwoods farm, is reinvigorated by the arrival of an army regiment, come to train in the area.

40.name: 'Blue Blazes' Rawden
40.description: Rawden, a lumberjack in the North woods, fights with crooked dance hall owner 'Ladyfingers' Hilgard over the affections of Babette DuFresne. Hilgard is killed. When Hilgard's mother and ...                See full summary »

41.name: Lost on Dress Parade
41.description: Towers Chandler saves a little out of his weekly pay from an architect's office and uses it to have a night on the town every few weeks. On one outing he meets a shop girl. When he boasts ...                See full summary »

42.name: Chase Me Charlie
42.description: Chase Me Charlie was an anthology consisting of excerpts from several of Chaplin's short films made for the Essanay Company, including The Tramp, Shanghaied, In the Park and The Bank.

43.name: The Yellow Ticket
43.description: Anna Mirrel, a young Jewish girl in Czarist Russia, is forced to degrade herself in order to visit her father, whom she believes to be ill. She obtains a yellow passport, signifying that ...                See full summary »

44.name: Restitution
44.description: "The picture discloses the perfect man and woman in Eden, and the tempation of Mother Eve [Lois Gardner] by Lucifer [Al Ernest Garcia]. Many episodes are then presented showing how Satan, ...                See full synopsis »

45.name: Tih Minh
45.description: Jacques d'Athys, a French adventurer, returns to his home in Nice after an expedition to Indochina where he has picked up a Eurasian fiancée and a book that, unbeknownst to him, contains a ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Gun Woman
46.description: A saloon owner loans her lover the money to buy a house, which he has led her to believe they will live in after they're married. Instead, he takes the money and buys a saloon in another town.

47.name: Lest We Forget
47.description: A story of the First World War, told in semi-documentary style, focusing on the iniquities of the German war machine, and with its dramatic center the sinking by a German U-boat of the ...                See full summary »

48.name: My Four Years in Germany
48.description: The experiences of the American ambassador to Germany, James Gerard, are recounted in this semi-documentary.

50.name: The Forbidden City
50.description: A Chinese mandarin hopes to regain favor with the Emporer by betrothing her to him, but he doesn't know she's secretly married to the American consul and pregnant.
